data.title: Experience the Magic of Broadway with The Stage Door's Production of "The Drowsy Chaperone" - The Independent
data.meta_description: The Stage Door proudly presents "The Drowsy Chaperone," a delightful musical comedy that will transport audiences back to the golden age of Broadway.
data.meta_site_name: The Independent | News Events Opinion More
data.text:
Experience the Magic of Broadway with The Stage Door’s Production of “The Drowsy Chaperone”

The Stage Door proudly presents “The Drowsy Chaperone,” a delightful musical comedy that will transport audiences back to the golden age of Broadway. Directed by the talented Dean Jones, choreographed by the dynamic Hannah Jordan, and featuring sensational music direction by Celeste Dixon, this production promises to captivate theatergoers from February 8th to February 24th at The Electric Theater.

Set against the backdrop of the roaring 1920s, “The Drowsy Chaperone” follows the story of a die-hard musical theater fan who finds solace in his favorite record, which magically brings to life the fictional 1928 musical of the same name. As the record spins, audiences are whisked away on a hilarious and heartwarming journey filled with mistaken identities, romantic entanglements, and larger-than-life characters.

“We are thrilled to bring this beloved musical to life on the stage of The Electric Theater,” said producer Jalee Scott. “With its toe-tapping tunes, witty humor, and charming storyline, ‘The Drowsy Chaperone’ is sure to entertain audiences of all ages.”

Under the direction of Dean Jones, the talented cast and crew have worked tirelessly to recreate the glamour and excitement of Broadway’s heyday. From dazzling dance numbers to show-stopping musical performances, this production promises to be a feast for the senses.

“I’m incredibly proud of the dedication and talent that our cast and crew have brought to this production,” said director Dean Jones. “Audiences are in for a real treat!”

Don’t miss your chance to experience the magic of “The Drowsy Chaperone” at The Electric Theater, located at 68 E Tabernacle St. Showtimes are at 7:30 pm on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays from February 8th to February 24th. Tickets are available now and can be purchased online at www.stagedoorutah.com or by calling (435) 656-4407.
